title: Sophisticated Canberra Wine Country Escape in Yass Valley
description:
Tap into the 160-year-old winemaking heritage of Canberra’s cool climate wine country with a stay at the effortlessly sleek Abode Murrumbateman. Less than a 40-minute drive from the heart of the city, where you’ll find attractions including the National Gallery of Australia and Parliament House, this boutique apartment-style hotel is the perfect destination for a wine-fuelled escape in the luscious Yass Valley.

Neighbouring highly acclaimed, world-class wineries and producers, and only a few minutes’ walk to local bakeries, cafés and parks, this former gold-mining village delivers up a feast for the senses with over 140 vineyards, 20 cellar doors, a plethora of restaurants serving Southern Tablelands delights and rich market flavours. After a day frolicking among the vines, return to your boutique room, decked out with a TV with STAYCAST streaming. There’s also the convenient Abode Pantry - stocked with healthy frozen meals, drinks and more - a sleek communal lounge with a cosy fireplace and fully equipped kitchen, complimentary parking, and a foyer lined with retro-inspired bikes - perfect for a day hopping from vineyard to cellar door.
offer_address: 57 Rose St New South Wales 2582 Australia
